page.title: 13THE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: THE SEWAGE WORKS N.E. OF LONGFORD WAS BUILT IN 1938 TO SERVE LONGLEVENS, INNSWORTH AND KINGSHOLM. BEFORE IT WAS BUILT PEOPLE IN THESE AREAS USED EARTH TOILETS. SEWAGE FROM LONGLEVENS, INNSWORTH, PLOCK COURT AND KINGSHOLM IS TAKEN ALONG PIPES TO THE WORKS. THERE IT IS FED INTO AERATION TANKS TO BE TREATED. HERE IT IS ATTACKED BY LITTLE 'BUGS' THAT LIVE IN THE TANKS. THE 'BUGS' USE A PROCESS CALLED 'BINICISON' TO REPRO- DUCE (1=2=4=8 ETC.) ONCE THE SEWAGE IS TREATED IT GOES INTO PRIMARY SEDIMENTATION TANKS TO HAVE THE BITS THAT BLOCK UP THE PIPES (NAPPIES ETC.) REMOVED.
